newsitem.title: USA: Open Market get U.S. OK to export software.
newsitem.headline: Open Market get U.S. OK to export software.

text.p: Open Market Inc Thursday said it has received approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce to export a 128-bit key length version of its Internet commerce software, OM-Transact.
U.S. export restrictions have required that most servers and browsers use 40-bit session keys which are vulnerable to certain types of security breaches, the company said.
A 128-bit key enables so many more combinations that such a breach is computationally unfeasible, the company said.
The encryption scheme is available to buyers, merchants, and Commerce Service Providers who communicate with OM-Transact using a 128 bit-enabled Web browser.
